body: @maxcon Thanks for reporting, it looks like a serious regression. The async callbacks were changed in 2.5.7. A reproducer would be great.

Here is the reproducer: https://github.com/maxcom/akka-streams-oom.

Process runs fine for at least 10 minutes on Akka 2.5.6, and runs of of memory on first minute in 2.5.7.

With the new async callbacks we have started to store async callbacks in `asyncCallbacksInProgress` of the `GraphStageLogic` until graph stage is stopped.

Unfortunately streams of streams are implemented by using async callbacks, which never get released and thus OOM.

To be more concrete, the issue here is `akka.stream.stage.GraphStageLogic.SubSinkInlet` which triggers the creation of one of those callbacks here: https://github.com/akka/akka/blob/3dc0adb4e9d7eb41d1fe7847dda61a0e01bd37fa/akka-stream/src/main/scala/akka/stream/stage/GraphStage.scala#L1250 

For `FlattenMerge` one is created per sub stream that is materialized, but as there is no way to signal that the `AsyncCallback` should be released/not kept around anymore when the sub sink has completed/canceled it stays in memory.

Problem is probably there for the opposite as well (`SubSourceOutlet`)
Hi guys, any estimate on fix?
We will take a deep look at this tomorrow.

issue.title: Fix for async callback memory leak

labels.name: tested
labels.description: PR that was successfully built and tested by Jenkins

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body:
Fixes #24046

I think providing explicit lifecycle control like this is the way to go for the very few cases where the async callback lifecycles aren't tied to the lifecycle of the stage.

issue.title: Memory leak in RequestTimeoutSupport with 2.5.6

labels.name: t:server
labels.description: Issues related to the HTTP server

labels.name: t:core
labels.description: Issues related to the akka-http-core module

repository.name: akka-http
repository.description: The Streaming-first HTTP server/module of Akka

issue.body:
Request timeout support creates one `AsyncCallback` per request. Pre 2.5.6 this was fine, but with the new `invokeWithFeedback` infrastructure in place it now keeps a reference to each `AsyncCallback`.  akka/akka#24046 introduces a way to release the callback, but I think we'll need to find a way to not create multiple callbacks here to not force a dependency on Akka 2.5.7.

Perhaps the callback can be created once in `RequestTimeoutSupport` and reused throughout its life?

issue.title: akka-http 10.0.11 (akka 2.5.7) memory leak

repository.name: akka-http
repository.description: The Streaming-first HTTP server/module of Akka

issue.body: After updating to a new version of `akka`(10.0.11) and `akk-http`(2.5.7). I got a memory leak: Memory: CPU: I have memory dump which was made after restart of machine: Unhealthy: If compare it with `akka`(10.0.10) and `akk-http`(2.5.6) Healthy: The memory report from eclipse mat is: ``` One instance of "akka.http.impl.engine.client.PoolSlot$SlotProcessor$$anon$1" loaded by "sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader @ 0x700000000" occupies 156,298,648 (28.91%) bytes. The memory is accumulated in one instance of "java.lang.Object[]" loaded by "". Keywords sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader @ 0x700000000 akka.http.impl.engine.client.PoolSlot$SlotProcessor$$anon$1 java.lang.Object[] ``` It appears with both `legacy` and `new` client thread pools.
